profiles.name: Balboa
profiles.bio: The Balboa is a swing dance that originated in Southern California during the 1920s (though it may have started as early as 1915) and enjoyed huge popularity during the 1930s and 1940s. The term Balboa originally referred to a dance characterized by its close embrace and full body connection. It emphasizes rhythmic weight shifts and lead-follow partnership.

profiles.name: Lindy Hop
profiles.bio: The Lindy hop is an American dance which was born in Harlem, New York City, in 1928 and has evolved since then with the jazz music of that time. It was very popular during the swing era of the late 1930s and early 1940s.

profiles.name: Blues
profiles.bio: Blues is a vintage dance that flourished with the growth of blues music in the juke joints, barrelhouses and rent parties in rural and urban America.  Like Lindy Hop, Blues dancing evolved from African rhythms and movements combined with elements of European partner dancing.
